key.name: period
key.description: The period with which requests are checked

key.name: verbosity
key.description: 0 for minor logging, 1 (default) for normal info, 2 for detailed info about requests

multisection.description: A non-empty sequence of request monitor handlers

key.name: time
key.description: The time after which the handler should be activated for the first time

key.name: factory
key.description:
The dotted path to a Python callable. It is called with this configuration as argument and must return another callable, the handler itself.
The handler is called with the arguments "request", "handlerState" and "globalState".
"request" is a ".Request" structure describing this request, including start time and PATH_INFO.
"handlerState" is a "._RequestState" instance describing the execution of the handler (how often called).
"globalState" is a dictionary mapping request ids to ".Request" instances (in order to support global descisions).

key.name: repeat
key.description: The maximal number of repetitions of handler calls for a single request. A negative value means indefinitely.
